text: Afraid not, portals without access to Design Manager don't get access to the template marketplace. I can see this changing as we're moving more of the drag and drop template customisation out of Design Manager and into the Editors, but for the moment I'm afraid not

Bc we want to add BriteVerify to our forms to enforce stronger leads. So if we have both HS and BV checking, it's a bit weird. It'd be easily to just have 1 check versus both check. At least, that was the thought process I was going through at the time.

How do you all handle using modern versions of Bootstrap (eg: v4) in custom modules, when drag and drop modules are using the watered down Bootstrap 2? Is there a best practice to integrating Bootstrap 4?

Hi. The client are using the CTA in HubSpot but the target page isn't in HubSpot. So we have to choose the external page option. As result it creates a redirect to HubSpot then to the external page. Are these redirect necessary for the tracking code?

For those interested in the developer event, we want your input whether you will physically attend or not. We have a quick survey.
We also have a few volunteer opportunities.

For event details join <#CCGU4R4ER|extend> and check out <https://devday.splashthat.com/>

Apologies for spamming it a little. We’re just down to the last 36 Days, and want to make sure everyone who needs to see it sees it.

question.  Can you test pop up forms in a staged page?

Also, has anyone hijacked the pop up form to link directly to a landing page instead of showing a form?
you can add the ability to make the popup form show when a perameter of your choosing is added to the url.
then you can go back and change that later to what works for you
I'm just on a CMS subscription at the moment, so I don't have access to URL params
I'm thinking that with what I want to achieve, I should just build something from scratch
Tl;dr Not actually using Hubpost forms on a HubSpot site, have been using unbounce, but cancelling our subscription soon

Hey there, Anyone know a way to add some onSubmit event to a HubSpot form? Documentation tells me that I only need to add onFormSubmit to my form but I use templates to use my form and I cant seem to find a way to add this code, the code its from google analytics

As far as I'm aware, onFormSubmit is only available when using the form's embed code, but you could create a custom module with your embed code that takes a form's ID as a field argument, essentially making it a custom form module.

Is there a known issue with the HS CTA tool? Second time in a week that I have not been able to publish a CTA because of the same error message: "Please complete all required fields," even when all fields have been completed.
I think that I found a way, using JS to for the submit event, just tested it with an alert and works. I hope that works. Thanks
also having some buggy behavior when cloning CTAs, onMouseUp seems to prematurely close the modal, even when I am just changing the name of the CTA within that text input
